con:settings.con:setting: <xml-fragment xmlns:con="http://eviware.com/soapui/config"> <con:entry key="Global Properties" value=""/> <con:entry key="TestSuite" value="FoundationAuth-GA TestSuite"/> <con:entry key="Report to Generate" value=""/> <con:entry key="Password" value=""/> <con:entry key="soapui-setings.xml Password" value=""/> <con:entry key="TestRunner Path" value=""/> <con:entry key="Tool Args" value=""/> <con:entry key="Ignore Errors" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Host:Port" value=""/> <con:entry key="WSS Password Type" value=""/> <con:entry key="Save Project" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Enable UI" value="false"/> <con:entry key="System Properties" value=""/> <con:entry key="Domain" value=""/> <con:entry key="Coverage Report" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Export JUnit Results" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Open Report" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Project Properties" value=""/> <con:entry key="Project Password" value=""/> <con:entry key="Export All" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Report Format(s)" value=""/> <con:entry key="TestCase" value="<all>"/> <con:entry key="Print Report" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Username" value=""/> <con:entry key="Root Folder" value=""/> <con:entry key="Save After" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Add Settings" value="false"/> <con:entry key="Endpoint" value=""/> </xml-fragment>

con:part.con:content:
Returns detailed information about this service

 Authenticate a client and generate an access token. There are various ways to authenticate in the global auth system. You can authenticate as a Racker, an application on behalf of a customer, or an application directly. Examples below show the different authentication mechanisms. You need a valid token for access. Check that a token is valid and return the token details. Revoke Token. Check if token has access to an application. Check if token has role on an application. You need a valid token for access. Gets a list of users. Allows you search for a user by username 0 based index to start list Number of records to be returned Adds a new user. The Username attribute is required in this request.If a blank password is passed in the Password element, the API will generate a random password for the user. The prefLanguage attribute defaults to "US_en" and the timeZone attribute defaults to "America/Chicago". Location to the uri of the newly created resource Get a user. Update a user. Delete a user. Get a user's secret question and answer. Sets a user's secret question and answer. Get a user's password credentials. Sets a user's password credentials. Reset a user's password credentials. Get a token that can be used to reset a user's password credentials. Get a list of a user's delegated refresh tokens. Get a user's delegated refresh token. Deletes a user's delegated refresh token. Get the applications that have been provisioned for a user. Provision an application for a user. Removed a provisioned application from a user. Get a list of user's global roles. Filter list of user roles by applicationId Grant user a global role. A global role is one that is not restricted just to a tenant. A global role could be application specific. A user could have the global admin role for the nova application, or a global admin role for all applications. Remove global role from user. Get a list of user's roles on all tenants. Filter list of user tenant roles by applicationId Filter list of user tenant roles by tenantId Grant user a role on the tenant Revoke a user's role on a tenant. You need a valid token for access. Gets a list of applications. Allows you search for an application by name 0 based index to start list Number of records to be returned Add an application. Location to the uri of the newly created resource Get an application. Update an application. Delete as application. Reset application secret. Get all applications that have been provisioned for this application.. Provision an application for this application. Removes a provisioned application from this application. Get a list of aplications's global roles. Filter list of aplication roles by applicationId Grant application a global role. A global role is one that is not restricted just to a tenant. A global role could be application specific. An application could have the global admin role for the nova application, or a global admin role for all applications. Remove global role from application. Get a list of applications's roles on all tenants. Filter list of application tenant roles by applicationId Filter list of application tenant roles by tenantId Grant application a role on the tenant Revoke an application's role on a tenant. You need a valid token for access. Get all roles. Name of the role Application that role is tied to. Add a new role. Can also add application specific roles by specifying the application id in the request payload. Location to the uri of the newly created role Get a Role Modify an existing role. Delete an existing role. You need a valid token for access. This is the customer's RCN. Adds a customer's identity profile. Location to the uri of the newly created customer identity profile Gets a customer's identity profile. Delete a customer's identity profile. Updates a customer's identity profile. Gets the password rotation policy for a customer. Sets the password rotation policy for a customer. Gets a list of users that this customer owns. 0 based index to start list Number of records to be returned Gets a list of applications that this customer owns. 0 based index to start list Number of records to be returned You need a valid token for access. Get password rules. Validate password to ensure it conforms to password rules.

Returns detailed information about this service

 Authenticate a client and generate an access token. There are various ways to authenticate in the global auth system. You can authenticate as a Racker, an application on behalf of a customer, or an application directly. Examples below show the different authentication mechanisms. Check that a token is valid and return the token details. Revoke Token. Check if token has access to an application. Check if token has role on an application. Gets a list of users. Allows you search for a user by username 0 based index to start list Number of records to be returned Adds a new user. The Username attribute is required in this request.If a blank password is passed in the Password element, the API will generate a random password for the user. The prefLanguage attribute defaults to "US_en" and the timeZone attribute defaults to "America/Chicago". Location to the uri of the newly created resource Get a user. Update a user. Delete a user. Get a user's secret question and answer. Sets a user's secret question and answer. Get a user's password credentials. Sets a user's password credentials. Reset a user's password credentials. Get a token that can be used to reset a user's password credentials. Get a list of a user's delegated refresh tokens. Get a user's delegated refresh token. Deletes a user's delegated refresh token. Get the applications that have been provisioned for a user. Provision an application for a user. Removed a provisioned application from a user. Get a list of user's roles on all tenants. Filter list of user tenant roles by applicationId Filter list of user tenant roles by tenantId Grant user a role on the tenant Revoke a user's role on a tenant. Get a list of user's global roles. Filter list of user roles by applicationId Grant user a global role. A global role is one that is not restricted just to a tenant. A global role could be application specific. A user could have the global admin role for the nova application, or a global admin role for all applications. Remove global role from user. Gets a list of applications. Allows you search for an application by name 0 based index to start list Number of records to be returned Add an application. Location to the uri of the newly created resource Get an application. Update an application. Delete as application. Reset application secret. Get all applications that have been provisioned for this application.. Provision an application for this application. Removes a provisioned application from this application. Get a list of applications's roles on all tenants. Filter list of application tenant roles by applicationId Filter list of application tenant roles by tenantId Grant application a role on the tenant Revoke an application's role on a tenant. Get a list of aplications's global roles. Filter list of aplication roles by applicationId Grant application a global role. A global role is one that is not restricted just to a tenant. A global role could be application specific. An application could have the global admin role for the nova application, or a global admin role for all applications. Remove global role from application. Add a new role. Can also add application specific roles by specifying the application id in the request payload. Location to the uri of the newly created role Get all roles. Name of the role Application that role is tied to. Get a Role Modify an existing role. Delete an existing role. Adds a customer's identity profile. Location to the uri of the newly created customer identity profile Gets a customer's identity profile. Delete a customer's identity profile. Updates a customer's identity profile. Sets the password rotation policy for a customer. Gets the password rotation policy for a customer. Gets a list of users that this customer owns. 0 based index to start list Number of records to be returned Gets a list of applications that this customer owns. 0 based index to start list Number of records to be returned Get password rules. Validate password to ensure it conforms to password rules.

Idm API Schema Types

This is the main index XML Schema document for the Rackspace Identity Management API.

User entities.

Application entities.

Customer entities.

Defines credentials used to obtain an OAuth token.

Password entities.

All fault types.

Password rotation policy.

Role entities.

Users

This schema file defines entities related to a user.

A user's password credentials.

A rackspace user's password.

A rackspace user.

A list of rackspace users.

A rackspace user's secret question and answer.

A rackspace employee

The user's new password.

The user's current password.

This flag indicates whether the old password must be verified, before any updates to this user's password can happen.

A user's secret question.

The answer to the user's secret question.

The user's secret contains a question and answer that can be used to confirm the user's identity.

A user's credential.

The unique id of the user.

The unique username of the user.

The customerId of the customer that the user is associated with.

The user's email address.

A unique rackspace personId for the user.

The user's first name.

The user's middle name.

The user's last name.

The user's display name.

The user's preferred language.

The airport code of the user's region.

A boolean which indicates if the user is enabled.

The user's country.

The user's time zone.

The date the user was created

The date a user was last updated

The boolean indicating if a user has been locked out due to the excessive login failures

The total nubmer of records in a search

A zero based offset for the subset of users returned in a search

The limit of users requested in a search.

A user's password.

The unique id of the user.

The racker's sso.

The racker's first name.

The rackers's last name.

The rackers's display name.

About the XML namespace

This schema document describes the XML namespace, in a form suitable for import by other schema documents.

See http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace.html and http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml for information about this namespace.

Note that local names in this namespace are intended to be defined only by the World Wide Web Consortium or its subgroups. The names currently defined in this namespace are listed below. They should not be used with conflicting semantics by any Working Group, specification, or document instance.

See further below in this document for more information about how to refer to this schema document from your own XSD schema documents and about the namespace-versioning policy governing this schema document .

lang (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value is a language code for the natural language of the content of any element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.

Notes

Attempting to install the relevant ISO 2- and 3-letter codes as the enumerated possible values is probably never going to be a realistic possibility.

See BCP 47 at http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt and the IANA language subtag registry at http://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry for further information.

The union allows for the 'un-declaration' of xml:lang with the empty string.

space (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value is a keyword indicating what whitespace processing discipline is intended for the content of the element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.

base (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value provides a URI to be used as the base for interpreting any relative URIs in the scope of the element on which it appears; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML Base specification.

See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for information about this attribute.

id (as an attribute name)

denotes an attribute whose value should be interpreted as if declared to be of type ID. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the xml:id specification.

See http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-id/ for information about this attribute.

Father (in any context at all)

denotes Jon Bosak, the chair of the original XML Working Group. This name is reserved by the following decision of the W3C XML Plenary and XML Coordination groups:

In appreciation for his vision, leadership and dedication the W3C XML Plenary on this 10th day of February, 2000, reserves for Jon Bosak in perpetuity the XML name "xml:Father".

About this schema document

This schema defines attributes and an attribute group suitable for use by schemas wishing to allow xml:base , xml:lang , xml:space or xml:id attributes on elements they define.

To enable this, such a schema must import this schema for the XML namespace, e.g. as follows:

<schema . . .>
           . . .
           <import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace"
                      schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd"/>

or

<import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace"
                      schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd"/>

Subsequently, qualified reference to any of the attributes or the group defined below will have the desired effect, e.g.

<type . . .>
           . . .
           <attributeGroup ref="xml:specialAttrs"/>

will define a type which will schema-validate an instance element with any of those attributes.

Versioning policy for this schema document

In keeping with the XML Schema WG's standard versioning policy, this schema document will persist at http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd .

At the date of issue it can also be found at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd .

The schema document at that URI may however change in the future, in order to remain compatible with the latest version of XML Schema itself, or with the XML namespace itself. In other words, if the XML Schema or XML namespaces change, the version of this document at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd will change accordingly; the version at http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd will not change.

Previous dated (and unchanging) versions of this schema document are at:

  • http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd
  • http://www.w3.org/2007/08/xml.xsd
  • http://www.w3.org/2004/10/xml.xsd
  • http://www.w3.org/2001/03/xml.xsd

Roles

This schema file defines entities related to a role.

A rackspace employee role

A list of roles.

The total nubmer of records in a search

A zero based offset for the subset of users returned in a search

The limit of users requested in a search.

Applications

This schema file defines entities related to an application.

A rackspace application.

A list of rackspace applications.

A rackspace applications's credentials.

The application's secret credentials.

The application's unique Id.

The unique Id for the customer the application belongs to.

The application name.

A boolean which indicates if the application is enabled.

The application Title that will be displayed to users.

A human readable description of what the application does.

The OAuth callback url for a application.

A one word description of a application.

The total number of applications in a search.

A zero based offset to a subset of applications.

The limit of the number of applications returned in a search.

An application's secret.

Identity Profile

This schema file defines entities related to an Identity Profile.

A rackspace customer's identity profile.

A list of rackspace customer identity profiles.

A unique id.

This is the customer number.

A boolean indicating if the customer is enabled.

A boolean indicating if the customer has been soft deleted.

Tokens

This schema file defines entities related to tokens.

Entities related users.

Entities related to applications.

The data returned for a successful authentication.

The data required for authentication.

An authentication Token.

A delegate Token.

A list of tokens.

A list of delegated tokens.

The token id.

A number of seconds until the token expires.

The token id.

A number of seconds until the token expires.

The clientId associated with the token

An access token.

A refresh token.

The user associated with the token.

An application associated with the token.

A racker associated with the token.

A boolean indicating if the token returned for a user is valid for password reset only because his password has expired.

The date a users password is set to expire.

The number of days until a users password expires.

The OAuth grant type.

The client Id.

The client secret.

The user's username.

The user's password.

The refresh token Id.

The authorization code.

The OAuth grant type authorization_code.

The OAuth grant type client_credentials.

The OAuth grant type password.

The OAuth grant type refresh_token.

This is an extended grant type. Enables us know if a racker is authenticating.

Passwords

This schema file defines entities related to a password.

A password rule.

A list of password rules.

A password validation.

A password rule result.

A list of password rule results.

A unique Id for the password rule.

The name of the password rule.

A human readable description of the rule.

A boolean which indicates whether the password passed the rule.

A unique Id for the password rule.

The name of the password rule.

A human readable description of the rule.

A boolean which indicates whether the password passed all rules.

Including the generic service common faults

The user has been disabled and is not permitted to authenticate.

An authentication request requires a username.

A user with that username already exists.

An application with that name already exists.

A permisssion with that Id already exists.

A user with that email address already exists.

A customer with that customerId already exists.

A baseUrl with that id already exists.

A client group with that name already exists.

The password failed validation.

User or admin attempted to update his/her own password more than once in the 24-hour period since the last self-update.

The password failed validation.

The user has not been provisioned for this service.

A human readable message that is appropriate for display to the end user.

The optional <details> element may contain useful information for tracking down errors (e.g a stack trace). This information may or may not be appropriate for display to an end user.

The HTTP status code associated with the current fault.

<xs:schema elementFormDefault="unqualified" version="1.0" targetNamespace="http://fault.common.api.rackspace.com/v1.0" xmlns:fault="http://fault.common.api.rackspace.com/v1.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:element name="serviceFault" type="fault:ServiceFault"/> <xs:element name="badRequest" type="fault:BadRequestFault"/> <xs:element name="unauthorized" type="fault:UnauthorizedFault"/> <xs:element name="itemNotFound" type="fault:ItemNotFoundFault"/> <xs:element name="forbidden" type="fault:ForbiddenFault"/> <xs:element name="methodNotAllowed" type="fault:MethodNotAllowedFault"/> <xs:element name="serviceUnavailable" type="fault:ServiceUnavailableFault"/> <xs:element name="unsupportedMediaType" type="fault:UnsupportedMediaTypeFault"/> <xs:complexType name="Fault"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Fault reporting structure</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="xs:int"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specifies the status code for the fault</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="message" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specifies the display message of the fault</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="detail" type="fault:Detail" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specifies the detail message of the fault</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="link" type="xs:anyURI" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specifies the uri for detail error message</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ServiceFault"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This is a concrete general fault that extends the standard fault element. We want individual services to define their custom faults as well by extending the base Fault. JAXB does not allow a parent class be the root element in a payload. Clients that need to customize their faults need to extend 'Fault'.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="fault:Fault"></xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="BadRequestFault"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="fault:Fault"></xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="UnauthorizedFault"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="fault:Fault"></xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ForbiddenFault"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="fault:Fault"></xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ItemNotFoundFault"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="fault:Fault"></xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ServiceUnavailableFault"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="fault:Fault"></xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="MethodNotAllowedFault"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="fault:Fault"/> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="UnsupportedMediaTypeFault"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="fault:Fault"/> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Detail"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="description" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Specifies the display message of the fault</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:any namespace="##any" processContents="lax" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:anyAttribute namespace="##other" processContents="lax"/> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema>

Users

This schema file defines entities related to a customer's password rotation policy.

A password rotation policy

Field indicating if the password rotation policy is enabled or not.

Password rotation duration in days.

con:method.name: Check if Token has Role on an Application
Check if Token has access to an Application
Get a Delegated Refresh Token for a User
Delete a Delegated Refresh Token for a User
Get a List of delegated refresh Tokens for a User
Provision an Application for a User
Remove Provisioned Application from a User
Get the Applications that a User has Provisioned
Revoke a User Role on Tenant
Provision an Application for an Application
Remove Provisioned Application from an Application
Get the Applications that an Application has Provisioned
Revoke an Application Role on Tenant

con:restRequest.name: Create Application - xml (POST)
con:restRequest.con:request: <application xmlns="http://idm.api.rackspace.com/v1.0" name="foundApp" customerId="RCN-987-654-321" description="Foundation Test App" />

con:config.script: def applicationId = context.expand( '${Create Application - xml (POST)#Response#declare namespace ns1=\'http://idm.api.rackspace.com/v1.0\'; //ns1:application[1]/@clientId}' ) testRunner.testCase.testSuite.setPropertyValue("applicationId", applicationId)

con:testCase.name: Get Applications (Resource: applications)
con:testCase.con:description: TestCase generated for REST Resource [applications] located at [/v1.0/applications]

con:testCase.name: Get Roles (Resource: roles)
con:testCase.con:description: TestCase generated for REST Resource [roles] located at [/v1.0/roles]

con:testCase.name: CRUD Roles (Resource: roles/{roleId})
con:testCase.con:description: TestCase generated for REST Resource [{roleId}] located at [/v1.0/roles/{roleId}]

con:restRequest.name: Update Role - xml (PUT)
con:restRequest.con:request: <role xmlns="http://idm.api.rackspace.com/v1.0" name="admin" description="Can admin the heck out of anything" applicationId= "${#TestSuite#applicationId}" />

con:testCase.name: Add User (Resource: users)
con:testCase.con:description: TestCase generated for REST Resource [users] located at [/v1.0/users]

con:config.script: random = new Random() userName = "aerwin"+ random.nextInt(50000000) log.info userName testRunner.testCase.testSuite.setPropertyValue("userName", userName)

con:restRequest.name: Create User (POST)
con:restRequest.con:request: <user xmlns="http://idm.api.rackspace.com/v1.0" region="SAT" prefLanguage="US_en" timeZone="America/Chicago" displayName="Alan Erwin" lastName="Smith" middleName="Lee" firstName="Alan" personId="RPN-111-111-111" email="alan.erwin@example.org" customerId="RCN-000-111-000" username="${#TestSuite#userName}"> <secret secretAnswer="Buddy" secretQuestion="What is your dogs name?" /> <passwordCredentials xmlns="http://idm.api.rackspace.com/v1.0" > <currentPassword password="C@n+f001me!" /> </passwordCredentials> </user>
